job_title: Food Service Worker in Elizabethtown, PA
pros: Decent benefits and time off Met good people working there Yearly gift from resident fund in the form of Giant gift cards
cons: Serious issues in management Favoritism A few key people in charge (chefs, sous chefs, management) will openly discuss or mock hourlies in front of other hourlies Seemed like they were getting rid of people who had worked in food service for years and years to replace them with kids from CTC programs rather than continuing to train from within. Was short staffed even before COVID

review_title: Poor Management is coveted and required. Excellent medical director.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Elizabethtown, PA
pros: Friendly staff, many devoted employees attempting to hang in there. The residents and families are incredible. If you are looking for a job where you can call off, be late, not be held accountable for for poor work performance. This is the place for you!
cons: Communication is severely lacking. Heavy upper management and nobody seems to know the answers to basic questions. All the ADON’s will provide conflicting information to staff, if they provide any. Managers have leadership meetings monthly, but there is no action for communicating any updates to staff. The current master plan appears to be swindling your way through issues. This organization operates from crisis rather than implementing procedures to mitigate adverse occurrences for patients. Beware!

pros: benefits, cost of living wage increase
cons: management really went down hill after former CEO left. Your last name determines if you will advance in the company

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Elizabethtown, PA
pros: Paid training, flexible hours (PRN), competaltice wages
cons: Teamwork was questionable depending on the unit, very physically demanding

pros: It was really nice meeting some of the residents
cons: Management was manipulative, corporate looked the other way, employees get away with murder and if you haven't been working there for 5+ years you are treated like you don't belong. They watch people like hawks, even if you are salary. They reveal personal information inappropriately and act like you are crazy for being upset about it. The Director talked badly about every single employee but was too afraid to stand up to any of them for fear of being disliked. This environment is toxic

pros: Residents and wellness programs are wonderful

review_title: Poor Upper Management poor employee treatment

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Warminster, PA
pros: This is not applicable. Thank you.
cons: There is no true HR function, you only have recruiting responsibilities - because turnover is so very rapid in this industry and this particular employer. Most of the staff are long-term employees who are set in their ways, entitled, no longer working hard or effectively, and know how to influence each other. So anyone new will be sabotaged. It is a "clique" with no desire to change or upgrade. The director in Warminster is overwhelmed, indecisive and easily offended by someone who is direct or thinks for themselves. She loves to complain about the other staff members but will do nothing to impact the situations.

pros: Environment is well taken care of. Coworkers are friendly. Residents are wonderful. Great place to work. Good health benefits!
cons: Pay could be higher however benefits greatly help!

pros: MVS has a very supportive team mentality. Excellent benefits. ANd the residents and families are wonderful
cons: Can be short staffed at times

job_title: Food Helper Clerk in Lafayette Hill, PA
pros: Awesome part time job with decent pay and pretty relaxed environment. Short days and not same guests every night so you build a relationship with them.
cons: Not a lot of room to grow. You can hit the ceiling pretty fast there. Not many full time spots that pay more than 15 an hour. Also on a part I’m basis work is only about 4-5 hours a day.

pros: friendly, clean, professional, learning experience

pros: salary and hours good.  Benefits are good and holidays are good.  small facility where everyone knows all residents.
cons: administrator relies too heavily on 2 particular employees and believes what they say.  Current employees should not be talking about former employees in a poor light.  Administrator needs to be more proactive in stopping this and instead of suspending and firing long term employees they need to better help current employees .  It's a shame this used to be a nice place to work.  Now everyone is so scared to get lose their license.

review_title: Clicktown and very inhospitable people...watch your back there
pros: Some benefits but even though they promise health insurance from day ONE never received ANY!
cons:
POOR training, Unfriendly, honestly.  The long-time employees were very unhappy there.  After I got in I found out long-time employees who had stood up for themselves GOT FIRED.  There are numerous right ups, pretty demoralizing.  
Perhaps, you will make the grade but I did not fit...and was not accepted.  a very clickish, and pretty unfriendly.  Example, I was paid several dollars less per hour than was in my interview.   Regret I opened this door...maybe upper management does not know these practices...I am thinking they probably do.

review_title: Companies like this are hard to find
pros: Better pay than any other place I interviewed, beautiful campus to walk during lunch, feel safe here, very caring place, get to know the residents.
cons: It's sometimes tough to handle seeing the downsides of the later years in life, but it's very rewarding. No vacation time your first year.

pros: Masonic Villages is a fantastic place to work! Most everyone is very friendly and accommodating, polite and always willing to help out. Excellent benefits and pay.
cons: The only challenge to working here is occasionally dealing with crabby people, but that comes with any job.

pros: The residents are so friendly and I enjoy going to work to talk to them, pays well, good hours, not hard to get more hours, weekends extra $1 an hour, 8 hour shifts extra 80 cents an hour, such an easy job
cons: No one really wants to take your shifts, schedule comes out 3 weeks in advance so sometimes hard to get off work, never get called off.

review_title: Overall it is a clean environment.  You will be working with the elderly on a daily basis.
pros: You hear a lot of great stories from the elderly. You will also create good friends amongst the staff.  Just take it for what it is.
cons: Your schedule will always change.  If you work in the dining hall, you will receive a base salary (tips are not allowed to be taken).  There is very little opportunity for growth especially if one starts out at the bottom.

pros: I've been with the Masonic Villages since 2008. As the organization has grown, I have been able to grow with it. The benefits are excellent, with competitive salaries. The atmosphere in my department is friendly and we work together as a team.
cons: Sometimes it's hard to remember that you're part of a multi-site operation, with decisions requiring extra thought before being implemented.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Elizabethtown, PA
pros:
Great shift differentials for evening and night shift.
Lots of open shifts if you like to work overtime.
Health care benefits.
cons:
Often shortstaffed
Memory care units give you a MUCH higher workload than typical long-term care (and pays the same amount)
Benefits like vacation and flex time don't kick in until you've worked there for a year.

pros: Resident contact is very rewarding. Newly remodeled building. Small facility, very home-like feel. Contingency of care because facility is small there are less staff that circulate.
cons: Inconsistent disciplinary actions. Reluctant to move forward with fully electronic charting, including MARs and TARs, communication with physicians and pharmacies. Staff falls into cliques making teamwork difficult

review_title: Cares about the staff and residents
pros: Great support from management - the organization is truly committed to serving others and cares for the staff. Offers excellent benefits.
cons: We wear many hats due to being a small campus and it can be overwhelming at times. Would like to see merit-based raises implemented.

pros: Excellent company to work for. Great benefits and they consider employees as family. This is a small facility which was fun to work in.
cons: Sometimes seems overwhelming with the number of "hats" the DON must wear!

pros:
Fair workload compared to other local nursing homes.

Opportunity to grow within company, especially in nursing. Clinical ladder & tuition assistance programs.

Pretty Campus, farmers market, cafes, and formal gardens.
cons: You have to pay for gym membership on campus, but pool is free.

cons: work e/o weekend isn't fun and not too many jobs offer no weekends unless you are in upper management

pros: Residents... Well some of them.
